com.client.Graphics

Class GraphicsAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.client.Graphics.GraphicsAbstract
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GraphicsCPU

    public abstract class GraphicsAbstract
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract graphics class. Handles the vague and graphics-backend-independent aspects of rendering the image (e.g., pixel coordinate conversion, coordinating drawing, etc.).
    Author:
    Ian

      • drawRectFill

        public static final void drawRectFill(int x,
                int y,
                int w,
                int h)
        Draws a filled rectangle. Coordinates are in typical 2D screenspace (i.e., y-axis reversed).
        Parameters:
        x - the starting x coordinate of the rectangle.
        y - the starting y coordinate of the rectangle.
        w - the width of the rectangle.
        h - the height of the rectangle.

        h - the height of the rectangle.

      • drawResource

        public static void drawResource(DrawableResource resource,
                int x1,
                int y1,
                int w1,
                int h1,
                int x2,
                int y2,
                int w2,
                int h2)
        Draws a DrawableResource.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to draw.
        x1 - source left
        y1 - source bottom
        w1 - source width.
        h1 - source height.
        x2 - destination left
        y2 - destination bottom
        w2 - destination width.
        h2 - destination height.

      • drawResource

        public static final void drawResource(DrawableResource resource,
                int x1,
                int y1,
                float w1,
                float h1,
                int x2,
                int y2,
                float w2,
                float h2)
        Draws a DrawableResource.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to draw.
        x1 - source left
        y1 - source bottom
        w1 - source width, as a percent of the source image's total width.
        h1 - source height, as a percent of the source image's total height.
        x2 - destination left
        y2 - destination bottom
        w2 - destination width, as a percent of the source image's total width.
        h2 - destination height, as a percent of the source image's total height.

      • convertMouseToMap

        public static final boolean convertMouseToMap(MutableInteger tile_x,
                        MutableInteger tile_y)
        Converts the mouse position to map coordinates.
        Parameters:
        tile_x - the result x coordinate.
        tile_y - the result y coordinate.
        Returns:
        true if successful.

      • convertPixelToMap

        public static final void convertPixelToMap(int pixel_x,
                     int pixel_y,
                     MutableInteger tile_x,
                     MutableInteger tile_y)
        Converts a pixel in proper coordinates ((0,0) is bottom-left) into map coordinates.
        Parameters:
        pixel_x - the pixel's x.
        pixel_y - the pixel's y.
        tile_x - the result x coordinate.
        tile_y - the result y coordinate.

        Draws a character at an absolute location and with the resource corresponding to its internal state.
        Parameters:
        character - the character.
        pixel_x - the absolute x coordinate.
        pixel_y - the absolute y coordinate.

        public static final void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Main drawing method. Called by the canvas when it's time to repaint.
